page.title: 19TRANSPORT AROUND BROMYARD
page.content: Before 1964, Bromyard had a{railway which provided a useful service for the public and helped to distribute industrial products, such as flooring tiles from the Stream Hall{Brick and {Tile Works.}Now, only a few remaining tracks can be seen near{Holden {Hydroman's factory}on the{new {industrial estate. In 1985 the{main public transport is by bus. In a rural community, bus services are necessary. The main bus services are{Midland Red, Jones and {Morris.}In June 1967, the{by-pass}was built to help relieve the congestion of traffic in the{narrow streets. Children who live outside Bromyard are taken to school by coach although most families own cars. During severe weather pupils from outlying farms are unable to attend school. Broad Bridge is the site of the local coach depot.
